wjhk.jupload2.policies
Interface UploadPolicy

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultUploadPolicy
public interface UploadPolicy

This interface contains all methods that should be given by any UploadPolicy. The abstract class DefaultUploadPolicy contains all default policy.
It allows to specify :

  • The way files should be managed.
  • The target URL.
  • The way files are uploaded :
  • File by file
  • All files at once
    • The current implemented upload policies are :
  • DefaultUploadPolicy. It's a 'simple' instanciation of each UploadPolicy methods. It makes JUpload work the same way as the original JUpload (v1).
  • CustomizedNbFilesPerRequestUploadPolicy is a DefaultUploadPolicy, which allows to control how many files are to be uploaded for each HTTP request.
  • FileByFileUploadPolicy is CustomizedNbFilesPerRequestUploadPolicy, where the number of files to upload for each HTTP request is ... guess ?!? ;-)
  • PictureUploadPolicy adds picture handling the the applet. The main functionnalities are :
  • Preview picture: The look of the applet changes, to allow display of the selected picture.
  • Rotation: you can rotate the picture by quarter of turn.
  • Resizing: the applet can resize picture before upload, to lower network (and time) transfert. Just specify a maximum width and/or height, in pixels.
  • CoppermineUploadPolicy is a special PictureUploadPolicy: it allows upload to the coppermine picture gallery.


    • From the application, the UploadPolicyFactory allows easy instanciation of the needed UploadPolicy.
    All constructors for class inherited from UploadPolicy should have a protected contructor: all class creations are controled by the UploadPolicyFactory, which is the only class that should be used to create upload policies. You can:
  • Create a new UploadPolicy, by using the getUploadPolicy methods.
  • Get the previously created UploadPolicy, by using the UploadPolicyFactory.getCurrentUploadPolicy() method.


    • The {link #progress} component is to be updated while uploading.
    The {link #status} component is to be used to display informations.

    To allow the easiest possible change of upload, all default upload code is embbeded into the DefaultUploadPolicy class.

    Author:
    Etienne Gauthier
    See Also:
    DefaultUploadPolicy

    createTopPanel

    public javax.swing.JPanel createTopPanel(javax.swing.JButton browse,
                                         javax.swing.JButton remove,
                                         javax.swing.JButton removeAll,
                                         javax.swing.JPanel mainPanel)
    This method is called to create the top panel. The default implementation is defined in DefaultUploadPolicy.createTopPanel(JButton, JButton, JButton, JPanel).

    Parameters:
    browse - The default browse button.
    remove - The default removeSelected button.
    removeAll - The default removeAll button.
    mainPanel - The panel that contains all objects. It can be used to change the cursor (to a WAIT_CURSOR for instance).
    Returns:
    the topPanel, that will be displayed on the top of the Applet.

    public FileData createFileData(java.io.File file)

    Parameters:
    file - The file used to create the FileData instance.
    Returns:
    A FileData instance. The exact class depends on the currentUploadPolicy.

    getUploadFilename

    public java.lang.String getUploadFilename(FileData fileData,
                                          int index)
    Get an upload filename, that is to be send in the HTTP upload request.

    Parameters:
    index - index of the file within upload (can be4, ou of 10 for instance).
    Returns:
    The upload filename

    getMaxFilesPerUpload

    public int getMaxFilesPerUpload()
    This function returns the number of files should be uploaded at a time. If negative or 0, all files are to be uploaded in one HTTP request. If positive, each HTTP upload contains this number of files. The last upload request may contain less files.
    Examples :
    • If 1 : files are uploaded file by file.
    • If 5 : files are uploaded 5 files by 5 files. If 12 files are uploaded, 3 HTTP upload are done, containing 5, 5 and 2 files.

    Returns:
    Returns the maximum number of files, to download in one HTTP request.

    displayDebug

    public void displayDebug(java.lang.String debug,
                         int minDebugLevel)
    log a debug message. Will be logged in the status bar, if defined.

    Parameters:
    debug - The message to display.
    minDebugLevel - If the current debug level is superior or equals to minDebugLevel, the message will be displayed. Otherwise, it will be ignored.

    addHeader

    public void addHeader(java.lang.String header)
    Add an header to the list of headers that will be added to ech HTTP upload request. This method is called from specific uploadPolicies, which would need headers to be added to all uploads. These headers are used in DefaultUploadPolicy.

    Parameters:
    header -
    See Also:
    onAppendHeader(StringBuffer)

    onAppendHeader

    public java.lang.StringBuffer onAppendHeader(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
    Append specific headers for this upload (session cookies, for instance). This method is called while building each upload HTTP request.

    Parameters:
    sb - The header StringBuffer where spécific headers should be appended.
    Returns:
    The StringBuffer given in parameters. This is conform to the StringBuffer.append method.
    See Also:
    addHeader(String), FileUploadThreadV3.doUpload(FileData[], int, int)

    afterUpload

    Parameters:
    e - null if success, or the exception indicating the problem.

    getServerProtocol

    public java.lang.String getServerProtocol()
    HTTP protocol that should be used to send the HTTP request. Currently, this is mainly used by CoppermineUploadPolicy, as the coppermine control that the protocol used for each HTTP request is the same as the one used during the session creation. It is used in the default policy, as it could be used elsewhere.
    Default is : HTTP/1.1

    Returns:
    The selected server protocol.

    getString

    public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
    Retrive a local property. Mainly used for localization.

    Parameters:
    key - The key, whose associated text is to retrieve.
    Returns:
    The associated text.
    See Also:
    DefaultUploadPolicy.DefaultUploadPolicy(String, Applet, int, JTextArea)

    getString

    public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key,
                                  java.lang.String value1)
    Retrive a local property. Mainly used for localization.
    All occurences of {1} in the value (corresponding to key) are replaced by value1.
    Sample :
    Love=Oh {1}, I love you so much ...
    Call it by getString("Love", "John Smith") ... ;-)

    Parameters:
    key - The key, whose associated text is to retrieve.
    value1 - The value, which will replace all occurence of {1}
    Returns:
    The associated text.
    See Also:
    DefaultUploadPolicy.DefaultUploadPolicy(String, int, Applet, int, JTextArea)

    getString

    public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key,
                                  int value1)
    Same as getString(String,String), but the given value is an integer.

    Parameters:
    key - The key, whose associated text is to retrieve.
    value1 - The value, which will replace all occurence of {1}
    Returns:
    The associated text.

    setDebugLevel

    public void setDebugLevel(int debugLevel)
    This method indicate whether or not the debug messages must be displayed. Default is no debug (0).
    To activate the debug, add a 'debug' parameter to the applet (with 1 to n value), or call this method. Currently, level used in the code are between 0 (no debug) and 100 (max debug).
    With a 0 value, no debug messages will be displayed.

    Parameters:
    debugLevel - The new debugLevel.

    getDebugLevel

    public int getDebugLevel()
    This method returns the current debug level.

    Returns:
    The current debug level
    See Also:
    setDebugLevel(int)
